_comment: This file is created by the lead agent at the start of each investigation. It lives in the investigation folder (e.g. AwsIamPrivilegeEscalation/tasks.json). The lead writes it; teammates read it to claim work and post completions.
question: What are the documented IAM privilege escalation paths in AWS that do not require existing admin permissions?

tasks.description: Investigate documented AWS IAM privilege escalation paths from non-admin starting positions. Write investigation.json to the investigation folder, run scripts/json_to_md.py, confirm scripts/check_sync.py exits 0, then mark this task complete.

Validate the investigation findings. Run scripts/check_sync.py first and paste the output verbatim into the report header. Verify every source URL (VERIFIED / REDIRECT / DEAD / UNVERIFIABLE). Spot-check high-stakes factual claims against live AWS documentation. Write validation_report.md to the investigation folder.

Arbitrate any disputed verdicts remaining after the first correction cycle. Read investigation.json and validation_report.md. For each CONTRADICTED or material UNVERIFIED item still outstanding, independently verify the claim using live sources. Cast a binding vote: SUSTAINED (validator was correct) or OVERTURNED (investigator was correct). Write arbiter_verdict.md to the investigation folder. Only triggered by the lead when a dispute exists after cycle 1.
